title: A JSON Schema for Swagger 2.0 API.

swagger.description: The Swagger version of this document.

host.description: The fully qualified URI to the host of the API.

basePath.description: The base path to the API. Example: '/api'.

consumes.description: A list of MIME types accepted by the API.

produces.description: A list of MIME types the API can produce.

x-ibm-configuration.title: A schema to represent the IBM specific API configuration

content.description: Activity to log when operation is successful

error-content.description: Activity to log when operation is not successful

outputNumber.label: Output numbers
outputNumber.description: Output XML numeric values in the resultant JSON as a number.  If false is specified, the numeric value will be output as a string.

outputBoolean.label: Output booleans
outputBoolean.description: Output XML boolean values in the resultant JSON as a boolean.  If false is specified, the boolean value will be output as a string.

outputNull.label: Output nulls
outputNull.description: Output empty XML elements in the resultant JSON as null.  If false is specified, the empty element will be represented as {}.

attributePrefix.label: Attribute prefix
attributePrefix.description: A string prefix to add to the XML attribute names in the resultant JSON.

attributeProperty.label: Attribute property name
attributeProperty.description: An optional string denoting the JSON object name that will contain the XML element's attributes.  If not specified, each attribute will be output as JSON properties of the object representing the XML element.

textAlwaysAsProperty.label: Text Always as Property
textAlwaysAsProperty.description: Output XML text nodes in the resultant JSON as a named property.  If false is specified, the text node will be output as a property value.

textProperty.label: Text Property name
textProperty.description: The property name to be used in the resultant JSON for text nodes.  If Text Always As Property is enabled, this string will be used as the property name for all text nodes.  If disabled, it is only used when additional properties for attributes and namespaces are present for the XML element.

namespaceProperty.label: Namespace Property name
namespaceProperty.description: The property name to be used in the resultant JSON for the object representing namespace nodes.

defaultNamespaceName.label: Default Namespace name
defaultNamespaceName.description: The property name to be used in a resultant JSON namespace object for a default namespace.

outputNamespaces.label: Output Namespaces
outputNamespaces.description: Output XML namespaces nodes in the resultant JSON.  If false is specified, the namespaces nodes are ignored.

title.description: A unique and precise title of the API.

version.description: A semantic version number of the API.

description.description: A longer description of the API. Should be different from the title.  Github-flavored markdown is allowed.

termsOfService.description: The terms of service for the API.

contact.description: Contact information for the owners of the API.

name.description: The identifying name of the contact person/organization.

url.description: The URL pointing to the contact information.

email.description: The email address of the contact person/organization.

name.description: The name of the license type. It's encouraged to use an OSI compatible license.

url.description: The URL pointing to the license.

paths.description: Relative paths to the individual endpoints. They must be relative to the 'basePath'.

definitions.description: One or more JSON objects describing the schemas being consumed and produced by the API.

parameterDefinitions.description: One or more JSON representations for parameters

responseDefinitions.description: One or more JSON representations for parameters

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the HTTP message.

summary.description: A brief summary of the operation.

description.description: A longer description of the operation, github-flavored markdown is allowed.

operationId.description: A friendly name of the operation

produces.description: A list of MIME types the API can produce.

consumes.description: A list of MIME types the API can consume.

responses.description: Response objects names can either be any valid HTTP status code or 'default'.

vendorExtension.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use.  Github-flavored markdown is allowed.

in.description: Determines the location of the parameter.

required.description: Determines whether or not this parameter is required or optional.
Determines whether or not this parameter is required or optional.

in.description: Determines the location of the parameter.

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use.  Github-flavored markdown is allowed.

required.description: Determines whether or not this parameter is required or optional.

in.description: Determines the location of the parameter.

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use.  Github-flavored markdown is allowed.

allowEmptyValue.description: allows sending a parameter by name only or with an empty value.

required.description: Determines whether or not this parameter is required or optional.

in.description: Determines the location of the parameter.

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use.  Github-flavored markdown is allowed.

allowEmptyValue.description: allows sending a parameter by name only or with an empty value.

required.description: Determines whether or not this parameter is required or optional.

in.description: Determines the location of the parameter.

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use.  Github-flavored markdown is allowed.

schema.description: A deterministic version of a JSON Schema object.

parametersList.description: The parameters needed to send a valid API call.

schemesList.description: The transfer protocol of the API.
